ygData.subject: Re: Pixie strike versus interrupting spell casters
ygData.msgSnippet: Interrupting casters is pretty difficult in any case, as NPC s have high channelling skills.  They ll resume much of the time, even if you manage to get a
ygData.messageBody:
Interrupting casters is pretty difficult in any case, as NPC's have high
channelling skills. They'll resume much of the time, even if you manage to get
a strike off.

Golias, Sol Ro




From: <kim@...>

Old message, but in light of the recent Lullaby test:

On Wed, 5 Jan 2000, Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4 wrote:
>
> Also, will pixie strike interrupt a spell even if the mob successfully
> resists?

>I ran into this problem in Kedge and Permafrost. The mob's
>eyes would glaze over, then they would finish casting. In one
>.....

>On a related note, it seems the different effects seem to have
>separate resist checks. Playing Pixie Strike on myself, I
>will often get the "you send forth music" message - there is
>no stun, but my MR does go down for the duration.

>John H. Kim
>kim@...
